metadata.Title: CVE-2012-1573 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
gnutls_cipher.c in libgnutls in GnuTLS before 2.12.17 and 3.x before 3.0.15 does not properly handle data encrypted with a block cipher, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption and application crash) via a crafted record, as demonstrated by a crafted GenericBlockCipher structure.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1573` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgnutls-openssl27 - 2.12.14-5ubuntu3
libgnutls26 - 2.12.14-5ubuntu3
libgnutlsxx27 - 2.12.14-5ubuntu3
No subscription required

gnutls-bin - 2.12.14-5ubuntu3
No subscription required

guile-gnutls - 3.0.21-1ubuntu1
libgnutls-xssl0 - 3.0.21-1ubuntu1
libgnutls28 - 3.0.21-1ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.0.21-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.14-5ubuntu3').
